It looked like a spider.I'm really curious about it.”- Ruud Schmidt, Leek, Holland Click for podcast.Spider-like aerial object photographed overPetten, Holland, around 1:30 PM to 1:35 PM on Saturday,September 8, 2007. Image © 2007 by Ruud Schmidt.Updated April 19 - See all original, untouched 13 digital images at end of thisEarthfiles report / April 17, 2009 Leek, Holland - Two years ago on May 4, 2007,Coast to Coast AM webmaster, Lex, received an email from a Central California residentwho called himself “Chad” about his photographing an odd, dragonfly-shaped, aerialobject. In an email a week later, Chad sent some of his photographs dated May 6, 2007. [See: 051507 Earthfiles for photos.] In addition to the dragonfly-shaped body that hadappendages sticking out from a large ring, there was another odd feature. Rising from thering straight up into the air were slightly curved, thin wires that formed a tall, circularcrown above the dragonfly body. Chad was worried about his family's safety and healthafter he saw the bizarre aerial object at least eight times from his house and on hikes nearhis home and heard a low, electrostatic hum coming from it. Neighbors, he said, had alsoseen the unidentified aerial object.Odd aerial “drone” photographed by “Chad” inCentral California, on May 6, 2007.Other 2007 photographs of dragonfly-shaped aerial objects began to emerge between Mayand June from Lake Tahoe, Capitola and Big Basin, California – all with appendagessticking out from a ring and the tall, thin wires extending high above. [ See EarthfilesArchive list below.]Another odd aerial “drone” photographedin Lake Tahoe, California, on May 5, 2007.Photographers requests anonymity.By June 17, 2007, I received a dozen paper photographs dated June 5th, 2007, in postoffice mail. The new “drone” looked more menacing and more complicated than the

others. I had taken to calling the objects “drones” because eyewitnesses had theimpression that the hovering craft were not manned. The dozen photographs were from aman who called himself “Ty B.” [ See 061707 Earthfiles for all twelve photographs.]One of twelve photographs in a series taken on June 5, 2007,by “Ty B” in which the aerial craft appears to rotate.Ty explained he photographed the large, dragonfly craft while bicycling with a group in theBig Basin Redwood Park near Saratoga, California. He said they all saw the dragonfly-shaped craft fade in and fade out three times above them. It was on the third fade in thatTy was able to take twelve photos, which he mailed to me.After the Big Basin craft photographs, other cases emerged in which eyewitnessessketched odd, aerial “dragonfly”-shape aircraft.Red circles are the 15 regions known in the United States to date in which20 eyewitnesses have reported seeing a wingless aerial craft with antenna appendageshovering and moving like a dragonfly, spanning 21 years from 1987 to 2008.Map © 2008 by Earthfiles. Map © 2008-2009 by Earthfiles. Chronological Order of Insect-type Drone Eyewitnesses in U. S., 1987 - 20081) 1987 - Barksdale AFB, Shreveport, Louisiana [ 053007 Earthfiles ]2) October 1995 - Sitgreaves National Forest, Heber, Arizona [ 062207 Earthfiles ]3) Mid-December 2001 - North of Cincinnati, Ohio, forest [ 060608 Earthfiles ]4) June 2003 - Hartshorne, Oklahoma backyard [ 030708 Earthfiles ]5) May 2005 - Sequoia National Park, California [ 052507 Earthfiles ]6) June 2005 - Downtown Memphis, Tennessee, home [ 071007 Earthfiles ]7) December 31, 2005 - Chicago, Illinois, Lakeshore Drive hotel [ 060608 Earthfiles ]8) May 2006 - Birmingham, Alabama, power line [ 052507 Earthfiles ]9 ) June 10, 2006 - Yosemite National Park, California [ 061507 Earthfiles ]10) June 2006 - Northridge Shopping Center, California [ 061507 Earthfiles ]11) May 5, 2007 - Lake Tahoe, California [ 051507 Earthfiles ]12) May 6, 2007 - Near Capitola, California (Chad) [ 051507 Earthfiles ]13) May 16, 2007 - Capitola, California, power line (Rajman) [ 052107 Earthfiles ]14 and 15) June 5, 2007 - Big Basin Redwood National Park, California (Steve and Ty B.)[ 060807 Earthfiles and 061707 Earthfiles ]16 and 17) June 7, 2007 - Camas, Washington over Lakamas Lake (Brent and Tim)

[ 050908 Earthfiles ]18) June 25, 2007 - Near Maxwell AFB, Montgomery, Alabama [ 062907 Earthfiles ]19 ) November 20, 2007 - Van Buren, Arkansas office [ 030708 Earthfiles ]20) March 31, 2008 - Scotts Valley, California home [ 040408 Earthfiles ] But no other 2007 photographs of the mysterious “drones” emerged - until now. OnSaturday, September 8, 2007, 49-year-old Ruud Schmidt was camping for the weekendwith his wife and family in Petten, Holland. For eighteen years, Ruud has worked as atherapist for the mentally handicapped in Leek, Holland, and he likes to relax near waterwith a fishing rod.On September 8, around 1:30 PM, he and his wife had walked to a small lake behind thecamp to fish when he suddenly saw an object in the sky about a mile away and maybe athousand feet up. There was no sound that he and his wife could hear and neither couldfigure out what they were seeing. Ruud took thirteen digital images with his Nikon D-50camera and its 100/300 mm Sigma Lens with Autofocus, a camera he had purchased newin 2005. Ruud told me that he took all the photographs in about six minutes. So now, I amadding another line to the chronological list of eyewitnesses:21) September 8, 2007 - Petten, Holland camp ground. [ 041709 Earthfiles ]Petten (red ci rcl e) has a campground near the North Sea beach i n northern Hol land.Update: See original, untouched, 13 digital images taken by Ruud Schmidt around 1:30PM and to 1:36 PM, on Saturday, September 8, 2007, at Petten, Holland, recreationalcamp ground at end of this report.Interview:Ruud Schmidt, therapist for mentally handicapped, Leek, Holland: “My wife, my twodaughters and my parents and my sister and brother-in-law all went camping just for acouple of days in Petten (weekend of September 8-9, 2007).My wife and I went fishing behind the camp where there was a small water lake. Suddenly,I saw something in the sky and we didn't know what it was. My wife said, 'Why don't youtake pictures of it?' I could not see what it was. It was only a black spot. But I had mycamera.I did not have binoculars, so I used my camera to see what it was. But it was very difficultbecause I could not recognize the object. I took twelve photos and on the computer athome, we looked at the thing in the sky and still did not know what it was.HOW FAR DO YOU THINK THE OBJECT WAS FROM YOU?I think about 2 kilometers (1.609 kilometers = 1 mile).ABOUT 1 MILE.

About a miles, yes.HOW HIGH IN THE AIR DO YOU THINK?Just a guess, but I think it was about 250 to 300 meters.THEN ABOUT A THOUSAND FEET?Ye s .COULD YOU HEAR ANY SOUND?No, we did not hear any sound. It looked like a spider. I'm really curious about it.” Petten, Holland “Spider” DroneSeptember 8, 2007Nikon D-50 Digital Camera6.1 Megapixels100/300 mm Sigma Lens with Autofocus.Saturday, September 8, 2007, around 1:30 PM in Petten, Holland, at camp ground.Original image © 2007 by Ruud Schmidt; blow-up overlay produced by UFOcasebook.com.The structure in the lower right corner is a Dutch air raid siren.
The structure in the lower right corner is a Dutch air raid siren.

Above images cropped and enlarged in Photoshop with Ruud Schmidt's permissionfrom his thirteen original digital images taken around 1:30 PM to 1:35 PM on Saturday,September 8, 2007, in Petten, Holland, campground.“YOU SAW IT AS A DARK OBJECT IN THE SKY. DID YOU KEEP WATCHING ITUNTIL - WHAT HAPPENED?We were fishing. After I took the pictures for about five or six minutes, we kept fishingand looked up to see if it was still there. We didn’t see it coming and we didn’t see itleaving. It was just gone.HOW MANY OF YOU SAW THIS ALL AT THE SAME TIME?Only me and my wife. The rest of the family was cooking.AFTER YOU HAD TAKEN THE 12 IMAGES ON YOUR NIKON CAMERA, DID YOUCONTINUE TO WATCH IT WITH YOUR EYES?Yes, but we went on fishing.SO, DID IT JUST DISAPPEAR WHILE YOU WERE WATCHING IT?No, we didn’t see it disappear. We were fishing and we looked to the water and thenlooked up and then it was gone.WHEN YOU HAD YOUR 13 IMAGES ON YOUR COMPUTER, DID YOU EVER ASKANY FRIENDS TO COME IN AND LOOK TO SEE IF ANYONE COULD RECOGNIZEIT? I asked my brother-in-law and my father. We are very skeptical people. I don’t know whatit is. It could be anything. We didn’t have any answers. I thought, ‘What do I do with this?’I did nothing. I left them on the computer. (laughs)SO, YOU LEFT THOSE TWELVE IMAGES OF THE UNKNOWN IN THE SKY ONYOUR COMP UTER UNTIL WHEN?Until last year, 2008. Then I spoke to a friend and he said maybe I should post them on awebsite to ask about what it is. I did, but I think it was the wrong website – it was theDutch Nibiru website in a forum for people to react and no one knew what it was. [Editor's Note: Nibiru is a “12th planet” described in ancient Sumerian texts as periodicallyinteracting with Earth's solar system.]So, last weekend (April 11-12, 2009), I wondered what more to do with the pictures and Iwas cleaning up my PC. Last year, I was also interested in UFOcasebook.com. Every day Ilook to see if there is something new and I posted it to the UFOcasebook. That man, BJ,was really enthusiastic to have me place photos in the forum to see if anyone knew what itwas. He did and then you emailed me and everybody emailed me about if I knew what itcould be?!Well, I don’t know what it is!

IF I UNDERSTAND, YOU HAD NEVER HEARD OF THE DRAGONFLY DRONEPHENOMENON EVER BEFORE?No, not really.HAD YOU EVER SEEN ANY OF THE PHOTOGRAPHS I POSTED IN 2007 ANDILLUSTRATIONS IN 2008 THAT LOOK A BIT LIKE DRAGONFLY INSECTS IN THESKY?No. When I posted on the UFOcasebook, there were many reactions. There are manypeople who are declaring me a liar. And that was frustrating.THAT WAS APPARENTLY PROVOKED BY SOME CALCULATEDMISINFORMATION CAMPAIGN BY PEOPLE UNKNOWN IN 2007 TRYING TOPAINT THE PHOTOS THAT EMERGED AS BEING HOAXED. ANYONE WHOCALLS YOU A LIAR HAS BEEN INFLUENCED BY THAT MISINFORMATION.YOU TOOK PHOTOGRAPHS OF AN UNIDENTIFIED OBJECT THAT YOU ANDYOUR WIFE SAW WHILE YOU WERE FISHING.Yes, the object was there. At the moment, we don’t know what it is. It could be anything.People said to me, ‘It’s a balloon. It’s a kite.’ I said, ‘OK, I photographed it with mycamera, but I don’t know what it is.’ That’s why I posted the photos.”Update April 19, 2009Original, untouched, 13 digital images taken by Ruud Schmidt around 1:30 PM and to 1:36PM, on Saturday, September 8, 2007, at Petten, Holland, recreational camp ground:http://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0731.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0732.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0733.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0734.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0735.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0736.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0737.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0738.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0739.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0740.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0741.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0742.JPGhttp://droneteam.com/Nederland/DSC_0743.JPGIf anyone has seen and/or photographed a similar “spider”-shaped aerial object or one ofthe “dragonfly”-shaped aerial craft, or drones, please email me: earthfiles@earthfiles.com. All requests for confidentiality are honored.
